Articles.Content: Why is Tony Stark called Iron Man when his (powered) suit is made out of titanium and other space-age materials ???
Ti-6Al-4V Man it's not a catching name, is it?

The very first Iron Man suit, as related in Tales of Suspense #39, back in 1963, was described as being made of iron (and run off transistors). By the time the Iron Man armor stopped being made of iron in the comics , there was no point in changing the name.

Marvel also has had a few Titanium Man characters, they're generally villains..

Edited July 17, 2014 by maltesh
